wms_article.title: Nonghyup Financialâ€™s H1 net income down 6.6%

wms_article_body.body: Nonghyup Financial Group Inc. reported a net income of 1.63 trillion won ($1.17 billion) in the first half of 2025, down 6.6 percent from a year earlier, according to regulatory filings on Thursday. Non-interest income, including fees, securities, and foreign exchange derivatives gains, rose 19.6 percent year-on-year to 1.33 trillion won. Interest income fell 5.3 percent to 4.1 trillion won over the same period as the net interest margin (NIM) declined. Nonghyup Bank posted a first-half net income of 1.19 trillion won, down 78.8 billion won from a year earlier. Nonghyup Life Insurance Co. and Nonghyup Property & Casualty Insurance Co. recorded declines of 5 percent and 20 percent in net income, to 154.7 billion won and 87.5 billion won, respectively. NH Investment & Securities Co. and Nonghyup REITs Management Co. posted sharp gains, with net income up 10 percent and 171 percent year-on-year to 465 billion won and 3.8 billion won, respectively. Nonghyup Financial said it expects to maintain a stable capital adequacy ratio in the second half through improvements in the common equity tier 1 (CET1) ratio and other measures.
